description: Imports table data from an S3 bucket.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Providing a ClientToken makes the call to ImportTableInput idempotent, meaning that multiple identical calls have the same effect as one single call. A client token is valid for 8 hours after the first request that uses it is completed. After 8 hours, any request with the same client token is treated as a new request. Do not resubmit the same request with the same client token for more than 8 hours, or the result might not be idempotent. If you submit a request with the same client token but a change in other parameters within the 8-hour idempotency window, DynamoDB returns an IdempotentParameterMismatch exception. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: S3BucketSource
parameters.description: The S3 bucket that provides the source for the import. S3BucketOwner (string) --- The account number of the S3 bucket that is being imported from. If the bucket is owned by the requester this is optional. The S3 bucket that is being imported from. S3KeyPrefix (string) --- The key prefix shared by all S3 Objects that are being imported.

nested_params.name: S3BucketOwner
nested_params.description: The account number of the S3 bucket that is being imported from. If the bucket is owned by the requester this is optional.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The S3 bucket that is being imported from.

nested_params.name: S3KeyPrefix
nested_params.description: The key prefix shared by all S3 Objects that are being imported.

parameters.name: InputFormat
parameters.description: The format of the source data. Valid values for ImportFormat are CSV, DYNAMODB_JSON or ION.

parameters.name: InputFormatOptions
parameters.description: Additional properties that specify how the input is formatted, Csv (dict) --- The options for imported source files in CSV format. The values are Delimiter and HeaderList. Delimiter (string) --- The delimiter used for separating items in the CSV file being imported. HeaderList (list) --- List of the headers used to specify a common header for all source CSV files being imported. If this field is specified then the first line of each CSV file is treated as data instead of the header. If this field is not specified the the first line of each CSV file is treated as the header. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Csv
nested_params.description: The options for imported source files in CSV format. The values are Delimiter and HeaderList.

nested_params.name: Delimiter
nested_params.description: The delimiter used for separating items in the CSV file being imported.

nested_params.name: HeaderList
nested_params.description: List of the headers used to specify a common header for all source CSV files being imported. If this field is specified then the first line of each CSV file is treated as data instead of the header. If this field is not specified the the first line of each CSV file is treated as the header.

parameters.name: TableCreationParameters
parameters.description: Parameters for the table to import the data into. The name of the table created as part of the import operation. The attributes of the table created as part of the import operation. (dict) --- Represents an attribute for describing the schema for the table and indexes. A name for the attribute. The data type for the attribute, where: S - the attribute is of type String N - the attribute is of type Number B - the attribute is of type Binary The primary key and option sort key of the table created as part of the import operation. (dict) --- Represents a single element of a key schema. A key schema specifies the attributes that make up the primary key of a table, or the key attributes of an index. A KeySchemaElement represents exactly one attribute of the primary key. For example, a simple primary key would be represented by one KeySchemaElement (for the partition key). A composite primary key would require one KeySchemaElement for the partition key, and another KeySchemaElement for the sort key. A KeySchemaElement must be a scalar, top-level attribute (not a nested attribute). The data type must be one of String, Number, or Binary. The attribute cannot be nested within a List or a Map. The name of a key attribute. The role that this key attribute will assume: HASH - partition key RANGE - sort key BillingMode (string) --- The billing mode for provisioning the table created as part of the import operation. ProvisionedThroughput (dict) --- Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use ProvisionedThroughput or OnDemandThroughput based on your table's capacity mode. For current minimum and maximum provisioned throughput values, see Service, Account, and Table Quotas in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. If read/write capacity mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST the value is set to 0. The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. OnDemandThroughput (dict) --- Sets the maximum number of read and write units for the specified on-demand table. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both. MaxReadRequestUnits (integer) --- Maximum number of read request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits to -1. MaxWriteRequestUnits (integer) --- Maximum number of write request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits to -1. SSESpecification (dict) --- Represents the settings used to enable server-side encryption. Enabled (boolean) --- Indicates whether server-side encryption is done using an Amazon Web Services managed key or an Amazon Web Services owned key. If enabled (true), server-side encryption type is set to KMS and an Amazon Web Services managed key is used (KMS charges apply). If disabled (false) or not specified, server-side encryption is set to Amazon Web Services owned key. SSEType (string) --- Server-side encryption type. The only supported value is: KMS - Server-side encryption that uses Key Management Service. The key is stored in your account and is managed by KMS (KMS charges apply). KMSMasterKeyId (string) --- The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption. To specify a key, use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. Note that you should only provide this parameter if the key is different from the default DynamoDB key alias/aws/dynamodb. GlobalSecondaryIndexes (list) --- The Global Secondary Indexes (GSI) of the table to be created as part of the import operation. (dict) --- Represents the properties of a global secondary index. The name of the global secondary index. The name must be unique among all other indexes on this table. The complete key schema for a global secondary index, which consists of one or more pairs of attribute names and key types: HASH - partition key RANGE - sort key (dict) --- Represents a single element of a key schema. The role that this key attribute will assume: HASH - partition key RANGE - sort key Represents attributes that are copied (projected) from the table into the global secondary index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected. ProjectionType (string) --- The set of attributes that are projected into the index: KEYS_ONLY - Only the index and primary keys are projected into the index. INCLUDE - In addition to the attributes described in KEYS_ONLY, the secondary index will include other non-key attributes that you specify. ALL - All of the table attributes are projected into the index. When using the DynamoDB console, ALL is selected by default. NonKeyAttributes (list) --- Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index. For global and local secondary indexes, the total count of NonKeyAttributes summed across all of the secondary indexes, must not exceed 100. If you project the same attribute into two different indexes, this counts as two distinct attributes when determining the total. This limit only applies when you specify the ProjectionType of INCLUDE. You still can specify the ProjectionType of ALL to project all attributes from the source table, even if the table has more than 100 attributes. (string) --- ProvisionedThroughput (dict) --- Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use either OnDemandThroughput or ProvisionedThroughput based on your table's capacity mode. OnDemandThroughput (dict) --- The maximum number of read and write units for the specified global secondary index. WarmThroughput (dict) --- Represents the warm throughput value (in read units per second and write units per second) for the specified secondary index. If you use this parameter, you must specify ReadUnitsPerSecond, WriteUnitsPerSecond, or both. ReadUnitsPerSecond (integer) --- Represents the number of read operations your base table can instantaneously support. WriteUnitsPerSecond (integer) --- Represents the number of write operations your base table can instantaneously support.

nested_params.name: TableName
nested_params.description: The name of the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_params.description: The attributes of the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_params.description: The data type for the attribute, where:

nested_params.name: BillingMode
nested_params.description: The billing mode for provisioning the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_params.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_params.description: Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use ProvisionedThroughput or OnDemandThroughput based on your table's capacity mode. For current minimum and maximum provisioned throughput values, see Service, Account, and Table Quotas in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_params.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. If read/write capacity mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST the value is set to 0.

nested_params.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_params.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. If read/write capacity mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST the value is set to 0.

nested_params.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_params.description: Sets the maximum number of read and write units for the specified on-demand table. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both.

nested_params.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_params.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits to -1.

nested_params.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_params.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits to -1.

nested_params.name: SSESpecification
nested_params.description: Represents the settings used to enable server-side encryption.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Indicates whether server-side encryption is done using an Amazon Web Services managed key or an Amazon Web Services owned key. If enabled (true), server-side encryption type is set to KMS and an Amazon Web Services managed key is used (KMS charges apply). If disabled (false) or not specified, server-side encryption is set to Amazon Web Services owned key.

nested_params.name: SSEType
nested_params.description: Server-side encryption type. The only supported value is:

nested_params.name: KMSMasterKeyId
nested_params.description: The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption. To specify a key, use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. Note that you should only provide this parameter if the key is different from the default DynamoDB key alias/aws/dynamodb.

nested_params.name: GlobalSecondaryIndexes
nested_params.description: The Global Secondary Indexes (GSI) of the table to be created as part of the import operation.

nested_params.name: IndexName
nested_params.description: The name of the global secondary index. The name must be unique among all other indexes on this table.

nested_params.name: KeySchema
nested_params.description: The complete key schema for a global secondary index, which consists of one or more pairs of attribute names and key types:

nested_params.name: Projection
nested_params.description: Represents attributes that are copied (projected) from the table into the global secondary index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

nested_params.name: ProjectionType
nested_params.description: The set of attributes that are projected into the index:

nested_params.name: NonKeyAttributes
nested_params.description: Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index. For global and local secondary indexes, the total count of NonKeyAttributes summed across all of the secondary indexes, must not exceed 100. If you project the same attribute into two different indexes, this counts as two distinct attributes when determining the total. This limit only applies when you specify the ProjectionType of INCLUDE. You still can specify the ProjectionType of ALL to project all attributes from the source table, even if the table has more than 100 attributes.

nested_params.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_params.description: Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use either OnDemandThroughput or ProvisionedThroughput based on your table's capacity mode. For current minimum and maximum provisioned throughput values, see Service, Account, and Table Quotas in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_params.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_params.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. If read/write capacity mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST the value is set to 0.

nested_params.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_params.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide. If read/write capacity mode is PAY_PER_REQUEST the value is set to 0.

nested_params.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_params.description: The maximum number of read and write units for the specified global secondary index. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both. You must use either OnDemandThroughput or ProvisionedThroughput based on your table's capacity mode.

nested_params.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_params.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxReadRequestUnits to -1.

nested_params.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_params.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table. To specify a maximum OnDemandThroughput on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits as greater than or equal to 1. To remove the maximum OnDemandThroughput that is currently set on your table, set the value of MaxWriteRequestUnits to -1.

nested_params.name: WarmThroughput
nested_params.description: Represents the warm throughput value (in read units per second and write units per second) for the specified secondary index. If you use this parameter, you must specify ReadUnitsPerSecond, WriteUnitsPerSecond, or both.

nested_params.name: ReadUnitsPerSecond
nested_params.description: Represents the number of read operations your base table can instantaneously support.

nested_params.name: WriteUnitsPerSecond
nested_params.description: Represents the number of write operations your base table can instantaneously support.

nested_items.name: ImportTableDescription
nested_items.description: Represents the properties of the table created for the import, and parameters of the import. The import parameters include import status, how many items were processed, and how many errors were encountered.

nested_items.name: ImportArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) corresponding to the import request.

nested_items.name: ImportStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the import.

nested_items.name: TableArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the table being imported into.

nested_items.name: TableId
nested_items.description: The table id corresponding to the table created by import table process.

nested_items.name: ClientToken
nested_items.description: The client token that was provided for the import task. Reusing the client token on retry makes a call to ImportTable idempotent.

nested_items.name: S3BucketSource
nested_items.description: Values for the S3 bucket the source file is imported from. Includes bucket name (required), key prefix (optional) and bucket account owner ID (optional).

nested_items.name: S3BucketOwner
nested_items.description: The account number of the S3 bucket that is being imported from. If the bucket is owned by the requester this is optional.

nested_items.name: S3Bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket that is being imported from.

nested_items.name: S3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: The key prefix shared by all S3 Objects that are being imported.

nested_items.name: ErrorCount
nested_items.description: The number of errors occurred on importing the source file into the target table.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the Cloudwatch Log Group associated with the target table.

nested_items.name: InputFormat
nested_items.description: The format of the source data going into the target table.

nested_items.name: InputFormatOptions
nested_items.description: The format options for the data that was imported into the target table. There is one value, CsvOption.

nested_items.name: Delimiter
nested_items.description: The delimiter used for separating items in the CSV file being imported.

nested_items.name: HeaderList
nested_items.description: List of the headers used to specify a common header for all source CSV files being imported. If this field is specified then the first line of each CSV file is treated as data instead of the header. If this field is not specified the the first line of each CSV file is treated as the header.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InputCompressionType
nested_items.description: The compression options for the data that has been imported into the target table. The values are NONE, GZIP, or ZSTD.

nested_items.name: TableCreationParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters for the new table that is being imported into.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_items.name: AttributeDefinitions
nested_items.description: The attributes of the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: A name for the attribute.

nested_items.name: AttributeType
nested_items.description: The data type for the attribute, where:
S - the attribute is of type String.
N - the attribute is of type Number.
B - the attribute is of type Binary.

nested_items.name: KeySchema
nested_items.description: The primary key and option sort key of the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: The name of a key attribute.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The role that this key attribute will assume:
HASH - partition key.
RANGE - sort key.

nested_items.name: BillingMode
nested_items.description: The billing mode for provisioning the table created as part of the import operation.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_items.description: Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use ProvisionedThroughput or OnDemandThroughput based on your table's capacity mode.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_items.description: Sets the maximum number of read and write units for the specified on-demand table. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both.

nested_items.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: SSESpecification
nested_items.description: Represents the settings used to enable server-side encryption.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether server-side encryption is done using an Amazon Web Services managed key or an Amazon Web Services owned key. If enabled (true), server-side encryption type is set to KMS and an Amazon Web Services managed key is used (KMS charges apply). If disabled (false) or not specified, server-side encryption is set to Amazon Web Services owned key.

nested_items.name: SSEType
nested_items.description: Server-side encryption type. The only supported value is:
KMS - Server-side encryption that uses Key Management Service. The key is stored in your account and is managed by KMS (KMS charges apply).

nested_items.name: KMSMasterKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key that should be used for the KMS encryption. To specify a key, use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. Note that you should only provide this parameter if the key is different from the default DynamoDB key alias/aws/dynamodb.

nested_items.name: GlobalSecondaryIndexes
nested_items.description: The Global Secondary Indexes (GSI) of the table to be created as part of the import operation.

nested_items.name: IndexName
nested_items.description: The name of the global secondary index. The name must be unique among all other indexes on this table.

nested_items.name: KeySchema
nested_items.description: The complete key schema for a global secondary index, which consists of one or more pairs of attribute names and key types:
HASH - partition key.
RANGE - sort key.

nested_items.name: Projection
nested_items.description: Represents attributes that are copied (projected) from the table into the global secondary index. These are in addition to the primary key attributes and index key attributes, which are automatically projected.

nested_items.name: ProjectionType
nested_items.description: The set of attributes that are projected into the index:
KEYS_ONLY - Only the index and primary keys are projected into the index.
INCLUDE - In addition to the attributes described in KEYS_ONLY, the secondary index will include other non-key attributes that you specify.
ALL - All of the table attributes are projected into the index.

nested_items.name: NonKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Represents the non-key attribute names which will be projected into the index.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProvisionedThroughput
nested_items.description: Represents the provisioned throughput settings for the specified global secondary index. You must use either OnDemandThroughput or ProvisionedThroughput based on your table's capacity mode.

nested_items.name: ReadCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of strongly consistent reads consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: WriteCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The maximum number of writes consumed per second before DynamoDB returns a ThrottlingException. For more information, see Specifying Read and Write Requirements in the Amazon DynamoDB Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: OnDemandThroughput
nested_items.description: The maximum number of read and write units for the specified global secondary index. If you use this parameter, you must specify MaxReadRequestUnits, MaxWriteRequestUnits, or both. You must use either OnDemandThroughput or ProvisionedThroughput based on your table's capacity mode.

nested_items.name: MaxReadRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of read request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: MaxWriteRequestUnits
nested_items.description: Maximum number of write request units for the specified table.

nested_items.name: WarmThroughput
nested_items.description: Represents the warm throughput value (in read units per second and write units per second) for the specified secondary index. If you use this parameter, you must specify ReadUnitsPerSecond, WriteUnitsPerSecond, or both.

nested_items.name: ReadUnitsPerSecond
nested_items.description: Represents the number of read operations your base table can instantaneously support.

nested_items.name: WriteUnitsPerSecond
nested_items.description: Represents the number of write operations your base table can instantaneously support.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The time when this import task started.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the creation of the table associated with this import task completed.

nested_items.name: ProcessedSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The total size of data processed from the source file, in Bytes.

nested_items.name: ProcessedItemCount
nested_items.description: The total number of items processed from the source file.

nested_items.name: ImportedItemCount
nested_items.description: The number of items successfully imported into the new table.

nested_items.name: FailureCode
nested_items.description: The error code corresponding to the failure that the import job ran into during execution.

nested_items.name: FailureMessage
nested_items.description: The error message corresponding to the failure that the import job ran into during execution.
